author: jgm
content:
FYI `ethereal` V2.7.0 displays information about EIP-1559 transactions, for example:
```
$ ethereal --network=ropsten transaction info --transaction=0x2185827098ea1312af76d63f434348e9f36afaa4090b37abc9594af9d5486e0d  --verbose
Type:            Mined transaction
Result:            Succeeded
To:            0x8A8eAFb1cf62BfBeb1741769DAE1a9dd47996192
Transaction type:    Dynamic
Nonce:            0
Gas limit:        209715
Gas used:        21204
Max fee per gas:    0.000028147497670947 Ether
Actual fee per gas:    1.12093022 GWei
Tip per gas:        4.581298467 GWei
Total fee:        0.000120910057079148 Ether ((1.12093022 GWei + 4.581298467 GWei) * 21204)
Value:            16 Wei
Data:            safeSend(0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000012)
```

You can grab `ethereal` at https://github.com/wealdtech/ethereal

author: lightclient
content: looks correct to me

author: timbeiko
content:
<@!420951281910284289> sorry for the delay! Geth's approach is here: https://gist.github.com/zsfelfoldi/9607ad248707a925b701f49787904fd6

I believe Besu + Nethermind followed a similar approach, but not 100% sure. Not sure about OE. Erigon is still working on a new design, described here: https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/wiki/Transaction-Pool-Design#design-proposal

author: lightclient
content:
bumping this again: https://github.com/ethereum/eth1.0-specs/pull/221
it appears geth rpc does not return `effectiveGasPrice` for tx receipts before london fork, where the spec says all receipts should now return `effectiveGasPrice` - do we change the spec or geth?

author: timbeiko
content: Do we know what other clients do?

author: timbeiko
content: It's not clear to me in your description if OE also omits it, <@!543900561460822016>

author: timbeiko
content: If so, then I agree we should change the spec, it's a bit weird to have it before London.

author: matkt0
content: In Besu for eth_getTransactionReceipt we return effectiveGasPrice for Pre-London block

author: timbeiko
content: Is an easy fix to make it optional pre-London ðŸ˜… ?

author: lightclient
content: i think it's easy either way, it just should be decided

author: lightclient
content: I think it's better to require always, because tools can know that the receipt will absolutely contain the effective gas price. If it's only included for post-1559 txs, it would have to get the receipt, check for existence of the field, then get the tx object if it's pre-1559 and get the tx's gas price

author: marekm3498
content: We don't return effectiveGasPrice for Pre-London block, but it will be very easy to change it

author: marekm3498
content: looks correct to me too
